name: NPR
text:
Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms: “I truly believe that this is the year that Georgia will have gone blue and that this is Joe Biden’s year in our state.”
https://t.co/7d0hhdayct

name: NPR
text: If you needed a drink Tuesday night, you definitely weren't alone. Alcohol delivery service Drizly noted that sales jumped across the country, rising the most in blue states -- doubling in New York City and D.C. -- and among liquor and wine drinkers. https://t.co/dTTKd4osGm

name: NPR
text:
Ja’Ron Smith, one of the highest-ranking African American officials in the White House, has announced he’s leaving the administration. He said President Trump still has his support.
https://t.co/H2w2eZ1EdX

name: NPR
text: Less than 10 months ago, the Boston Red Sox parted ways with manager Alex Cora for his role in the Houston Astros sign-stealing scandal. Today, not long after the end of his MLB-mandated season-long suspension, they rehired him. https://t.co/yoEa1Hc6SL

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Georgia's second Senate race will head to a runoff between Democrat John Ossoff and GOP Sen. David Perdue, pushing back Democrats' hopes of a chamber takeover to January.
https://t.co/1rypmN18Nl

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Aides have been counseling President Trump that legal options to fight election results are limited. “It’s dawning on him” he could lose, a source tells NPR. "He never thought he could lose."
https://t.co/1eZLrr3x5b

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden is set to speak shortly, as his lead against President Trump has widened in key battleground states.

Watch live:
https://t.co/TvSy7YtvZg

name: NPR
text: Only 10 of the Navy's 268 admirals are African American, most are rear admirals and none holds the 2 highest ranks, according to data from a task force examining the history of discrimination in the Navy. https://t.co/tv6nlePcy7

name: NPR
text:
"What's becoming clear each hour is that record number of Americans, of all races, faiths, religions, chose change over more of the same," Joe Biden said Friday, urging calm and patience as votes continue to be counted.

Watch his remarks:
https://t.co/Ej2huew3ka

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration in the past 2 days has abruptly dumped the leaders of 3 agencies that oversee the nuclear weapons stockpile, electricity and natural gas regulation, and overseas aid.
https://t.co/Wabk4J45ZO

name: NPR
text:
The stock market racked up its best week since April despite the unresolved election. The S&P 500 surged 7.3% for the week, while the Dow rose about 1,800 points, an increase of 6.9%.
https://t.co/3obtNPOwQi

name: NPR
text:
NEW: Mark Meadows, the chief of staff to President Trump, has tested positive for the coronavirus. He was last seen by reporters on election night.
https://t.co/tRFdg51SBR

name: NPR
text:
15 states and D.C. have signed onto a pact to award all of their presidential electors to the candidate who wins the national popular vote. The bill requires more support to be enacted.

Here's what the change would mean for the U.S. ⤵️
https://t.co/nae9VQ5lQA

name: NPR
text:
Purina is launching an insect-based dog and cat food in Switzerland — in a move to embrace more eco-friendly protein sources. The secret ingredient? Black soldier fly larvae.
https://t.co/X6BJ4TVbfu

name: NPR
text:
No, you should not rub hand sanitizer inside your nostrils. "Putting hand sanitizer on your nostrils isn't a barrier to breathing in the virus."
https://t.co/mbCEz09cdc

name: NPR
text: Berlin Tegel airport opened in 1948 and is closing as the city's new international hub opens after a series of delays. Although COVID-19 has hampered travel, Germans are visiting Tegel to relive old memories. https://t.co/VHJO3vSvoi

name: NPR
text: A successful ballot measure will make Colorado the first state where voters direct the reintroduction of gray wolves rather than the federal government, which previously brought wolves back to the northern Rockies, New Mexico, Arizona and the Carolinas. https://t.co/AjhecodAYb

name: NPR
text: Desperate parents in India, left without a livelihood in the pandemic, are rushing to marry off underage daughters. One official tasked with fighting child marriages says most cases used to involve 16 or 17-year-olds, but now the brides are as young as 12. https://t.co/6Cka6bWzdY

name: NPR
text: Emma Duncan, 17, designed and built display cases and installed them on the grounds of her local Audubon Center. It puts her one step closer to becoming an Eagle Scout — and she wasn’t even allowed to join the Scouts until last year. @keranews https://t.co/lVa5jLx57H

name: NPR
text: We deleted a previous tweet that used an incorrect last name for Emma. https://t.co/pmPeVJzzPe

name: NPR
text:
RT @davidfolkenflik: People! I'm about to talk about Rupert Murdoch, Donald Trump. and their mutually beneficial alliance, and the endgame playing out on Fox News

8.40am ET on @NPRWeekend  with the irrepressible @nprscottsimon 

https://t.co/iMzJzIPEkw

name: NPR
text:
Where the presidential race stands as of Saturday morning, per the AP:

• No winner declared

• Biden has 264 electoral votes; Trump has 214

• Biden leads in Georgia and Pennsylvania

• Both states remain too close to call as ballot-counting continues https://t.co/OGaA06qs5M

name: NPR
text: Follow live updates here: https://t.co/Tq2M0mTLaK

name: NPR
text:
Here's a look at where the race stands as of 8:41 a.m., according to AP data.

Follow live results here: https://t.co/Jp2Yng2jED https://t.co/qcaMrE1q4P

name: NPR
text:
How deftly Fox News presents Joe Biden's rising election fortunes — and how soon it does so — will help determine how readily its viewers, the president's fans and the president himself come to terms with it.
https://t.co/oCdcteiZ1f

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: Will the presidential election end up before the Supreme Court?

Probably not: Experts say it's unlikely the justices want to insert themselves into the political brambles when there's no evidence of major fraud or misbehavior that would sway the outcome. https://t.co/1ZqYQjW52P

name: NPR
text: Read the full story here ➡️ https://t.co/Yajs4AYVDj

name: NPR
text:
What are the chances that this election ends up before the Supreme Court? In other words: Will 2020 be a replay of Bush v. Gore?

Election experts of all political persuasions say it is highly unlikely. https://t.co/EdmYJoo3v5

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: "It's dawning on him...He never thought he could lose."

A former Trump campaign adviser tells NPR aides to the president have been counseling him that his legal options to try to contest the election are limited, but Trump wants to fight it out. https://t.co/DrNEHYjJAp

name: NPR
text:
Kamala Harris has made history.

She brings a legion of firsts to the vice presidency: She will be the first woman, the first Black person, the first Indian American and the first Asian American to hold the office.
https://t.co/YC0sDK3Pzk

name: NPR
text: RT @benswasey: Statement by President-elect Biden: https://t.co/sZ0X7tdhxO

name: NPR
text: RT @jmsummers: Kamala Harris's rise to Vice President elect makes a statement about a changing nation and this moment in our politics. Here's my take on what it means: https://t.co/RUj4n5C1xM

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden says he's “honored and humbled by the trust the American people have placed in me.”

“With the campaign over, it’s time to put the anger and the harsh rhetoric behind us and come together as a nation."
https://t.co/gemgrYYESp

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: ELECTION UPDATE: Joe Biden has won the state of Nevada, according to an AP race call. https://t.co/2kGnboz5q2 https://t.co/vP4Lzkg3G3

name: NPR
text: RT @joannakakissis: Joe #Biden declared winner #USPresidentialElections2020 tops media headlines + homepages in Europe. Thread with a few snapshots, beginning in #Greece https://t.co/GtlVTTxmfFJoe #Biden declared winner #USPresidentialElections2020 tops media headlines + homepages in Europe. Thread with a f… https://t.co/C6HLcoc4qv

name: NPR
text:
The AP has called the presidency for Joe Biden, after he surpassed 270 electoral votes, but President Trump is refusing to concede and released a statement falsely claiming the election was "far from over."
https://t.co/ieS9QN4Fgy

name: NPR
text:
RT @scottdetrow: The president is not conceding and claims he won.

But as major news outlets call the race for Biden, we are seeing world leaders congratulate the president-elect. https://t.co/yo8UecN12r
